did.abstract: One letter from Edward Cantrell asking assistance in securing his release from Johnson's Island, Ohio prison; and one letter from Charles A. Dana to Frank A. Burr describing his mission to the Department of the Mississippi in 1863 to make a financial report, his engagement in the cotton trade, and the problems between the cotton trade and military operations. President Ulysses S. Grant, and Edwin McMasters Stanton are also mentioned.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Charles Anderson Dana (1819-1897) was a journalist and an editor of the NEW YORK SUN.
